content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace (position: 0.0, 0.0) – Smelts iron ore into iron plates to support crafting.
• Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) – Stores produced iron plates.

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (-16.0, -51.0)
Consists of:
• Burner Mining Drill (position: -16.0, -51.0) – Extracts iron ore.
• Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -49.5) – Transfers ore from the extraction point.
• Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -49.5) – Delivers extracted ore.
• Iron Chest (position: -13.5, -49.5) – Stores delivered ore.
• Intermediate Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -47.5) – Feeds ore to a remote branch.
• Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -47.5) – Moves ore along the intermediate belt.
• Remote Output Chest (position: -13.5, -47.5) – Receives ore for further routing.

### Copper Furnace at position (-27.0, -60.0)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace (position: -27.0, -60.0) – Smelts copper ore into copper plates.

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Consists of:
• Lab (position: 0.5, 2.5) – Processes science packs.
• Offshore Pump (position: -7.5, 25.5) – Draws water for powering lab systems.
• Boiler (position: 2.0, 17.5) – Intended to connect at (2.5, 19.5); remains NOT_CONNECTED due to persistent fluid connection issues.
• Steam Engine (position: 5.5, 5.5) – Generates electricity; integration pending due to missing fluid connection.

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Consists of:
• Assembling Machine (position: 3.5, 0.5) – Configured for pipe crafting; not receiving electricity and missing required iron-plate resource.
• Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) – Stores crafted pipes.
• Electricity Network – A series of small electric poles linking production components.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Fluid Connection Candidate Not Found Errors
 - Repeated fluid connection attempts near (-1.5, 17.5) have failed. Previous attempts used candidate PipeGroup fluid_system IDs [24500, 24642, 24784, 24926, 25068, 25210, 25352, 25494, 25636, 25778, 25920, 26062, 26204, 26346, 26488, 26630, 26772, 26914, 27056, 27198, 27340, 27482, 27624, 27766, 27908, 28050, 28192, 28334, 28476, 28618, 28760, 28902, 29044, 29186, 29328, 29470, 29612, 29754, 29896, 30038, 30180, 30322, 30464, 30606, 30748, 30890, 31032, 31174, 31316, 31458, 31600, 31742, 31884, 32026, 32168, 32310, 32452, 32594, 32736, 32878, 33020, 33162, 33304, 33446, 33588, 33730, 33872, 34014, 34156, 34298, 34440, 34582] and [34724, 34866, 35008, 35150, 35292, 35434, 35576, 35718]. New attempts in Steps 464–471 using candidate fluid_system IDs [35860, 36002, 36144, 36286, 36428, 36570, 36712, 36854] have also failed.
   Ensure that a valid PipeGroup candidate is present and correctly positioned before attempting a fluid connection.

• Manual Pipe Placement Issues
 - Verify that target tiles are unoccupied before initiating placement.

• Insufficient Inventory for Fluid Connections
 - Confirm that all required resources (e.g., pipes) are available in the inventory before connection attempts.

• Crafting Sub-Ingredient Limitations
 - Ensure that all necessary sub-ingredients, such as iron plates, are available to support production processes.

• Assembling Machine Resource and Power Issues
 - Connect the assembling machine in the Pipe Production Facility to a stable power network and supply it with required resources.

NAMESPACE
────────────────────────
• get_entity(entity: Any, position: Any) -> Any  
 Retrieves an entity of the specified type at the given position; returns the entity on success or raises an exception if not found.

• pipe_entity(pipe: entities.Pipe) -> Any  
 Processes a pipe entity during pipeline connection routines.

• rotate_entity(entity: Any, direction: Any) -> Any  
 Rotates the given entity to the designated direction to correct its alignment during placement.

• insert_item(resource: Any, target: Any, quantity: int) -> Any  
 Attempts to insert a specified quantity of the resource into the target inventory; returns the updated target on success or raises an exception if the resource is unavailable.

• get_connection_amount(virtual_candidate: Any, boiler_connection: Any, pipe_proto: Prototype.Pipe) -> int  
 Calculates the number of pipe segments required to establish a fluid connection between a virtual candidate and the boiler’s connection point; raises an exception if fluid conditions do not match.

Important Variables:
• pump_working (OffshorePump) [Type: OffshorePump] – Holds the working offshore pump entity at position (-7.5, 25.5).
• boiler_original (Boiler) [Type: Boiler] – Represents the boiler entity at position (2.0, 17.5).
• candidate_intermediate_offpump (Position) [Type: Position] – Candidate intermediate connection point for linking the Offshore Pump.
• candidate_intermediate_boiler (Position) [Type: Position] – Candidate intermediate connection point for linking the Boiler.
• boiler_connection_point (Position) [Type: Position] – Intended connection point for the Boiler’s water supply at (2.5, 19.5).
• steam_engine_connection_point (Position) [Type: Position] – Intended connection point for the Steam Engine’s steam input at (5.5, 5.5).
• pipe_count (int) – Represents the current number of pipes available in the inventory.
• distance (float) – Calculated distance for pipe network segments.
• final_inventory (Inventory) – Snapshot of inventory item counts after recent operations.
• virtual_candidate (Position) [Type: Position] – Virtual candidate connection point used for manual pipe placement at (-1.5, 17.5).
